column5: After not getting out fishing much over the winter I've had the chance to fish the lower Niagara at the glen three times over the past few weeks.  These were some of my best days I've had for lake trout, the first I went 7/7, then 2/3 with the biggest laker I've caught.  Today was the most recent, I went 3/3. Here are the highlight pictures:     This was the biggest.  Fought for a good 20 min and I ended up running 3-400 ft down the shore to keep up with it
beauty laker
Nice hook ups. Were you using spoons?
Nice!
Nice lakers !!!! That last one is a tank !!!! Well done
Love big lakers, that last one is a cow!
All but one were caught on a kwikfish on a 3 way rig with a 3/4oz pencil weight.  The last one today was caught on a streamer I tied. Pretty much any minnow imitator will work.
Love the picture of the cow. Great background scene
nice! that last one must have been a real rush in that water on light tackle
Very nice!!
Great fish, fishin' & pics.  Thanks for reporting.
Great pics. That last one is a brute
Wow, biggest laker I've seen caught from shore.    Congrats!
SWEET !!!
Awesome day of fishing!
Nice tanker!
The Niagara River is awesome, love every trip I make there.  That's a beauty!  RJ
Beauty Hawg Laker!!!!!!!!!!!! Stocked fish too eh
Nice fish well worth the hike out
Love usin the baitcaster down there.....what rod are you using?  Awesome fish and pics too
catching those from shore, wow ... very nice ...

Thanks everyone.  It was a blast catching those down there. I was using my calcutta 100dc on a st. Croix 9'6" wild river rod. 12lb floro mainline and 10lb leader. The 7 fish day I was by myself which makes landing them quite tricky.
